description: berry fruit and olive aromas along with  slightly reduced note of rubber andor latex open this full chewy and tannic cabernet from  wet and cool vintage given its birth year this is  big success it tastes of pure blackberry and cassis with smoky oak helping things along on the finish this is full and ripe but not overly complex drink through   varietal wine from the elusive appellation this impresses in its layering of rich toffee chocolate and blackberry plum sumptuous soft and voluptuously built it combines fruit and spice around toasted oak and firm graphite flint and toasted oak accent  core of brawny concentrated black fruit in this estate red clove black currant cigar box and firm structured tannins contribute to the classic nature of this wellmade wine enjoy spicy in blackberry and chocolate this is  smooth soft and moderately complex red made in small quantities from the wellknown appellation  hint of expected dustiness wavers amidst the fruit and currant cassis and crushed rock accent  soft richly layered and concentrated body of firm intensity and tannin in this blockdesignate from the warm site tasting of cocoa powder blueberry jam and toasted oak the wine finishes quietly and with  touch of this vintage of two passions is evocative but  little young and raw its incredibly minty with  fair lick of green bell pepper graphite and mineral notes at the fore pipesmoke woodspice and currant aromas take up the rear tannins are fine tight and powdery and the acidity is  little sharp this feels like it needs more time to knit together despite already having several years of bottle age try in  and then drink until jammy blueberry cherry and chocolate flavors make for  densely packed bullet of richness and rounded tannins in this valleyfloor wine well made and complex in structure it delivers  lasting punch of clove tobacco and dried very ripe aromas of blackberry jam and sweet cedar show on the nose of this bottling the palate is candied with blackcherry juice and maplesyrup very full aromas of black cherry smoke and crushed stone make for  pleasing nose on this bottling the flavors are approachable if simplistic with more black cherry and oak backed by forgiving tannins and substantive this is   varietal wine aged two years in new french oak leather cigar and black currant highlight  smoothly structured richly fullbodied wine that shows warmth and oodles of oak meet gobs of fruit in this ripe mature and readytodrink wine toast nutmeg vanilla and cedar wrap around rich plum and  touch of raspberry while full body adds to  generous baking chocolate cherry cordial green herb and anise aromas are at the fore plump upfront flavors follow with the tannins bringing  bit of grit give it time to settle this big but balanced wine carries aromas of black cherry and mint the palate offers  firm texture with fresh flavors of ripe black cherry cranberry and black this is the winerys first reservelevel offering coming from  multiclonal block of cabernet at this vineyard aromas of coffee chocolate toast and herb are at the fore reserved chocolatey flavors follow the barrel influence shows more strongly than the norm for this winery but it has good stuffing best after this wine offers  bright nose of sweet oak which leads to succulent waves of cherry plum and currant on the palate flourishes of cedar and dried herb meld with  wealth of soft silky extracted aromas of red berry purple flowers and peppery spice are very tangy on the nose of this bottling the palate is also very tangy with red currant and pomegranate balsamic flavors framed by buoyant acidity and background bell pepper hard spice and green tobacco aromas blend with milder notes of cherry and plum this feels lean crisp and punchy while the flavor profile is tart and gritty with green notes infused into basic plum flavors heat and scratchy tannins roughen up the aromas of black plum black olive and violet lead into  texturally dynamic palate loaded with ripe but not overdone black currant baking spice and vanilla flavors strong acidity drives the theres no question that this wine brings the funk cassis bud freshly tilled soil chimney and ember aromas are followed by flavorful cherry notes on  deft palate it shows  surprising amount of structure for the rocks district theres also  mouthwatering sense to it that ups the interest along with  long finish cabernet from this area is unique and hasnt gotten as much attention as other this wine may be  bordeaux blendwith  small amount of merlot cabernet franc and petit verdot in the mixbut its unmistakably margaret river in style its spicy and concentrated with blackcherry and cassis fruit tobacco leaf mint mocha and graphite and more earthy herbal notes theres  fair lick of oak influence here too the palate is powerful but poised framed by ultrafine herbandgraphite tannins and lifted by crisp acidity still  baby this fine wine should gain heaps of complexity with time drink  and likely this is  spicy herbal and thickly concentrated wine grippy in tannin and brawny black fruit the big flavor is complemented by complex elements of cedar clove and cigar boxlasting notions on the finish that would benefit from more time in bottle enjoy best from like leeuwin estate stella bella lies in the southern part of margaret river where climes are  little cooler and wines  tad fresher this approachable red berry and floral example shows  fair lick of toasted coconut oak but its tucked in with savory graphite and warm earth tones the freshness element is especially felt on the palate where acidity lifts the fruit into crunchiness cinched by spicy sinewy tannins the oak does get  bit blocky here but all is forgiven thanks to those interestingly textured tannins and bright fruit drink now through deep and dark in the glass this bottling shows intense blackberryjam aromas alongside  hint of cedar the flavors and texture fill the mouth delivering dense blackberry dried violets and roasted coffee against chalky yet polished tannins drink now through from estategrown fruit  varietal this is  bold concentrated and wellstructured wine big in grippy tannin and robust oak the dark brooding berry fruit is contrasted in tobacco and tar with  lasting flinty warm aromas of black cherry caramel and cola promise  comforting sip on this rich and ripe wine from one of the regions more beautiful estates rich cassis and blackberry flavors meet with spicy touches of sarsaparilla and mocha on the sip which is framed by chalky yet slender this winery celebrates its  anniversary of this wine and what  two decades it has been with  healthy  petit verdot and  dash of merlot  aromas of char cherry citrus generous barrel spice bay leaf plum thyme and anise lead to elegant classically styled fruit flavors with lipsmacking acidity and tannins that give  gentle but notable squeeze its  throwback wine leave it until at least the more affordable little sister of mount eden this wine which is bolstered by  merlot  cabernet franc  petit verdot and  malbec offers black plum wet river stones dusty herbs and wood spice on the nose the palate focuses on minerality structure and savory flavors including subtle lavender and black plum the structure will last for ages drink this is  restrained and polished wine that neatly demonstrates margaret rivers ability to produce world class cabernet it opens fairly delicately with aromas of cherries red currents licorice tobacco leaf and graphite with  touch of olive and peppery wood spice the palate then comes at you full throttleacid oak tannins fruit and alcoholtheres nothing shy or demure here but theres also bags of complexity regionality and ageworthiness drink now with time in decanter and protein or better yet wait  this cab is classic margaret river from  longstanding estate offering  plethora of aromas from ripe plums blackberries and licorice to cedar pencil lead olive brine and mint its fairly full figured but theres focus and restraint amidst cabernets inherent power silky fruit herbal tannins and plenty of savory spice set this wine up for  long life drink now through its hard to believe that this is vasse felixs middletier red such is its pedigree with  little malbec and petit verdot in the mix this cabernet is classic margaret river balancing power and structure with complexity and poise evoking the springtime scents of this coastal region it billows ripe red currents eucalyptus sage beach scrub and sea spray set up for aging tannins are fine and vicelike and the oak is fairly prominent but all should settle into place with  few more years in bottle drink now until pleasing aromas of cocoa thyme dark coffee graphite and cherry lead to elegant lipsmacking flavors that still carry  sense of richness refined subtle tannins back it up coffee notes linger on the finish the balance is spot on and it brings an unabashed sense of this wine is  fullbore fullbodied effort that shows intensely concentrated blackfruit blackpepper and woodsmoke aromas followed by  wave of superripe flavors an attractive charcoal and ironlike quality comes out with time in the glass firm tannins keep it well wrapped up but this is not necessarily an ager enjoy through this is signature margaret river  nose of ripe cherries and raspberries is backed by savory spices eucalyptus pencil lead black olives and some floral nuances the mouthfeel has lovely tension and lift to it the acidity counteracting the dryness of the powdery tannins that slink around
